channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland

item.title: Northern Trust radiologist review identifies 43 discrepancies
item.description: The Northern Trust says six of these could have had "significant clinical impact" on patients.

item.title: Gas bills: Northern Ireland customers facing price rise
item.description: NI's Utility Regulator says gas bills could increase by more than £100 a year.

item.title: High Street voucher scheme aims to launch on 12 September
item.description: Every adult in Northern Ireland will be eligible for a £100 pre-paid card.

item.title: Edwin Poots 'intending to run' in 2022 assembly election
item.description: Edwin Poots, Sir Jeffrey Donaldson and Paul Givan are all set to stand in Lagan Valley constituency.

item.title: Mullaghglass landfill: Legal action taken against council
item.description: Residents say the smell is giving them headaches and nausea, as well as affecting their mental health.

item.title: BBC NI Spotlight programme receives Docs Ireland award
item.description: The investigative current affairs programme is awarded outstanding contribution to documentary film.

item.title: Edwin Poots reveals framework for future of NI agriculture
item.description: The minister's policy paper outlines proposals for how NI farming will be funded in the future.

item.title: Man in 20s shot in leg in Newtownabbey
item.description: A man is taken to hospital after being attacked in Newtownabbey on Tuesday night.

item.title: Big increase in turnover for building product firm MacBlair
item.description: MacBlair said it saw very strong demand in the home and gardens improvements sectors.

item.title: Beacon Hospital: School 'did not solicit' Covid vaccines
item.description: The Beacon Hospital in Dublin had administered 20 Covid-19 vaccines to teachers at a private school.

item.title: Bracken bashing in the Castlerock countryside
item.description: Environmentalists are trying to help native species and wildlife to thrive in the coastal area

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: McClements fifth in 400m freestyle heat
item.description: Newtownards teenager Barry McClements misses out on a place in the S9 400m freestyle final at the Paralympics despite swimming a personal best time.

item.title: Covid-19: Samantha Willis' husband speaks of pain of her death
item.description: Josh Willis says he tried to arrange for his wife to hold her newly-born daughter Eviegrace.

item.title: Dr Anne McCloskey: GP suspended over Covid-19 vaccine comments
item.description: Dr Anne McCloskey posted a video on social media claiming vaccines were "damaging" young people.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Social deprivation a factor' in low vaccine uptake
item.description: NI's chief scientific adviser also says Northern Ireland is close to the peak of the Covid-19 surge.

item.title: Covid-19: Twelve more Covid-related deaths and 1,648 new cases
item.description: There are currently 420 patients with Covid-19 in Northern Ireland's hospitals, with 41 patients in ICU.

item.title: Covid-19: More than 12,000 vaccine doses given out at weekend
item.description: It comes as the health minister says the time is not right to re-impose tighter restrictions in NI.

item.title: Covid-19: PCR test market needs 'cleaning out', says Randox boss
item.description: Peter Fitzgerald says some Covid-19 test firms may not be delivering the service they claim.

item.title: Covid-19: More than 8,000 first jabs given in weekend vaccine push
item.description: The total is still being counted and the exact number is expected to be announced on Monday.

item.title: Covid-19: Where are Covid-19 vaccine clinics in NI?
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a coronavirus jab at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: High pressure driving dry weather in Northern Ireland
item.description: Dry weather is expected over the next seven days, with warm temperatures set to peak on Wednesday.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Meet Northern Ireland's Paralympians
item.description: With the Tokyo Paralympics getting underway a year later than planned, meet the seven Northern Irish athletes ready to compete in Tokyo

item.title: Boris Johnson's Irish Sea tunnel vision - roadworthy or pipe dream?
item.description: A BBC documentary asks how serious is Boris Johnson about a link from Scotland to Northern Ireland?

item.title: Dementia and the power of sporting memories
item.description: Recollections from the terraces or the pitch can be invaluable for sports fans with dementia.

item.title: Restoring a habitat by bashing bracken
item.description: Volunteers are trying to restore the habitat on the moors of Castlerock in County Londonderry.

item.title: Covid-19: Samantha Willis' husband speaks of pain of her death
item.description: The husband of a woman who died with Covid-19 after giving birth speaks about the pain of losing her.

item.title: Magee Medical School: 'I am very excited to get started'
item.description: A former investment banker and an ex-political adviser are among the first students at a new medical school in Londonderry.

item.title: The NI inventor who saved thousands of lives
item.description: The plane ejector seat was invented by James Martin, from Crossgar in County Down, in 1944.

item.title: Tralee: Swimmer rescued after nearly 12 hours at sea
item.description: The man, believed to be from Londonderry, was spotted floating with a pod of dolphins miles from shore.

item.title: Sinn Féin Foyle MLAs to step down before September
item.description: Martina Anderson and Karen Mullan will not return to the Assembly, but will take on new party roles.

item.title: Samantha Willis: Funeral of woman who died with Covid-19 after giving birth
item.description: Samantha Willis, who had Covid-19, died after giving birth to her fourth child.

item.title: PSNI defends response to shots at republican mural
item.description: The police say officers were in the area when shots were fired before a commemoration in Londonderry.

item.title: Afghanistan: Irish citizens wait for rescue mission
item.description: Troops and diplomats are assist more than 30 people who are struggling to get to Kabul airport.

item.title: Irish Army Rangers go to Kabul to help evacuation
item.description: Foreign Minister Simon Coveney says the small team will assist in the evacuation of Irish citizens.

item.title: Galway M6 crash victims were Kurdish family
item.description: The family, which included an eight-month-old baby girl, had been living in Ireland since 2017.

item.title: Galway: Infant and parents among four dead in collision
item.description: Police say four people died at the scene of the three-vehicle collision on the M6.

item.title: Wally the walrus to get his own pontoon
item.description: It is hoped the floating platform will stop the walrus from sinking more boats.
